channel.description:
I have just noticed this bug in one of the .java files on a 508 server. I doubt any of you have this problem, but if so I found the fix.
I was scimming through the .java files of one of the more blank 508 bases, and found this:
[code]public static String[] bannedUsers = new String[][/code]
To fix this little error, simply go into the Server.java, and find:
[code]public static String[] bannedUsers = new String[/code]
After you've found it, highlight it and replace it with this:
[code]public static String[] bannedUsers = new String[1000][/code]
Not sure if this'll help many people, but I have about 90 friends who've found this.

item.dc:creator: @Different1 Different`
item.description:
@Different1 wrote:

I have just noticed this bug in one of the .java files on a 508 server. I doubt any of you have this problem, but if so I found the fix.

I was scimming through the .java files of one of the more blank 508 bases, and found this:

public static String[] bannedUsers = new String[]

To fix this little error, simply go into the Server.java, and find:

public static String[] bannedUsers = new String

After you’ve found it, highlight it and replace it with this:

public static String[] bannedUsers = new String[1000]

Not sure if this’ll help many people, but I have about 90 friends who’ve found this.
